statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Rashawn Thomas had 28 points and 11 rebounds to lead Texas A&M-Corpus Christi to a 72-60 win over Abilene Christian on Saturday night.
article.headline: Thomas scores 28, leads A&M-CC to 72-60 win over ACU
article.linkText: Thomas scores 28, leads A&M-CC to 72-60 win over ACU
article.story: CORPUS CHRISTI, Texas -- Rashawn Thomas had 28 points and 11 rebounds to lead Texas A&M-Corpus Christi to a 72-60 win over Abilene Christian on Saturday night. Thomas was 10 of 16 from the floor. Ehab Amin, who drilled 4 of 6 from long range, added 23 points with five assists for the Islanders (11-9, 4-5 Southland Conference) who are 6-0 against Abilene Christian. A&M-CC pulled away in the first half to go into the break leading 37-25. ACU's Payten Ricks hit a 3 to close to 61-51 at the 7:32 mark of the second half. Amin responded with a 3-pointer and Thomas followed with a layup and the Islanders cruised to the victory. The Islanders shot 55 percent from the floor in the first half while limiting ACU to 7-of-20 shooting. A&M-CC hit 50 percent for the game. Jaren Lewis and Drake Green had 11 points apiece for ACU (8-12, 2-7).
